009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
012import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
013import java.io.File;
014import java.io.FileInputStream;
015import java.io.FileOutputStream;
016import java.io.IOException;
017import java.io.InputStream;
018import java.io.ObjectInput;
019import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
020import java.io.ObjectOutput;
021import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
022import java.io.OutputStream;
023
024/**
025 * Helper class providing static methods for writing/reading serialized data
026 * to/from files. It is recommended to serialize only data structures composed
027 * of standard Java types. Otherwise, if self-defined classes are reloaded,
028 * classes of previously serialized objects may not match any more, causing a
029 * {@link ClassNotFoundException} to be thrown.
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/07/28
033 */
034public abstract class SerializationHelper {
035        
036        // This class is not supposed to be instantiated.
037        private SerializationHelper() {}
038        
039        /**
040         * Writes a serialized representation of an arbitrary Java object to 
041         * a file.
042         * @param obj the object to be serialized.
043         * @param file the file to write to.
044         * @return the full path of the written file.
045         */
046        public static String writeObject(Object obj, File file) {
047                String path = file.getAbsolutePath();
048                try (FileOutputStream strm = new FileOutputStream(file);
049                         OutputStream buffer = new BufferedOutputStream(strm);
050                         ObjectOutput output = new ObjectOutputStream(buffer);) 
051                {
052                        output.writeObject(obj);
053                } catch (IOException e) {
054                        System.err.println(e.toString());
055                        return null;
056                }
057                return path;
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * Reads an object from a serialization file.
062         * The return value must be cast to the appropriate type, which
063         * must be known.
064         * @param file the file to read.
065         * @return the object reconstructed from the file representation or null if unsuccessful.
066         */
067        public static Object readObject(File file) {
068                Object obj = null;
069                try (InputStream strm = new FileInputStream(file);
070                         InputStream buffer = new BufferedInputStream(strm);
071                         ObjectInput input = new ObjectInputStream(buffer);) 
072                {
073                        obj = input.readObject();
074                } catch (ClassNotFoundException | IOException e) {
075                        System.err.println(e.toString());
076                        return null;
077                }
078                return obj;
079        }
080
081}
